#summary Human Nerves
[Home] -> [BiologicalLifeResearch] -> [HumanNerves]
----

This page is intended to list all nerves of biological human, which connect mind to human limbs and visceral organs.
Related findings are structured by other research themes.

<wiki:toc max_depth="2" />

Coverage verified by:
  * http://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/nerve (name base)
  * http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves (MA reference)

= CRANIAL NERVES =

  * *abducent nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne170.htm ABDUCENT NERVE]; sixth cranial nerve, VI); ORIGIN={a NUCLEUS in the pons, beneath the floor of the fourth ventricle, emerging from the brain stem anteriorly between the pons and medulla oblongata}; DISTRIBUTION={lateral rectus muscle of eye}; MODALITY={motor}; FIBERS={GSE:[BrainRegionVBA_HP_ABD Abducens Nucleus,VBA.HP.ABD] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EYE Eye,TARGET.TSA.EYE]}
<img src="http://drugline.org/img/term/abducent-nerve-38_2.jpg" alt="unavailable">
  * *accessory nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne198.htm ACCESSORY NERVE]; eleventh cranial nerve, XI); BRANCHES={the roots unite to form the trunk of the accessory nerve, which divides into an internal branch (cranial portion) and an external branch (spinal portion)}; MODALITY={parasympathetic and motor}
   * *accessory nerve, internal*; ORIGIN={by cranial ROOTS from the side of the medulla oblongata, from the ambiguus nucleus}; DISTRIBUTION={the internal branch to the vagus and thereby to the palate, pharynx, larynx, and thoracic viscera, pharyngeal and superior laryngeal branches of the vagus, muscles of the pharynx, larynx, and soft palate}; FIBERS={SVE:[BrainRegionHMA_HM_AMB Ambiguus Nucleus,HMA.HM.AMB] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH]}
   * *accessory nerve, external*; ORIGIN={by spinal roots from the side of the spinal cord (from the upper three or more cervical segments), from the nucleus of accessory nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={the external branch branches to the sternocleidomastoid and trapezius muscles (shoulder)}; FIBERS={GSE:[BrainRegionHMA_SC_VH_ISL Spinal Accessory Nucleus,HMA.SC.VH.ISL] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_NECK Neck,TARGET.TEA.NECK]}
<img src="http://www.edoctoronline.com/media/19/photos_584F5F8B-BB77-4B55-B7AE-E3D5F97F3938.gif">
  * *facial nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne171.htm FACIAL NERVE]; seventh cranial nerve, VII); ORIGIN={inferior border of pons, between olive and inferior cerebellar peduncle}; BRANCHES={consisting of two ROOTS: a large motor root, which supplies the muscles of facial expression, and a smaller root, the intermediate nerve (q.v.).}; branches of motor root: stapedius and posterior auricular nerves, parotid plexus, digastric, temporal, zygomatic, buccal, lingual, marginal mandibular, and cervical branches, and a communicating branch with the tympanic plexus}; DISTRIBUTION={various structures of face, head, and neck}; MODALITY={motor, parasympathetic, general sensory, special sensory}
   * *auricular nerve, posterior* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne177.htm POSTERIOR AURICULAR NERVE]; facial nerve, occipital branch, facial nerve proper); ORIGIN={facial nerve}; BRANCHES={it divides into auricular and occipital branches}; DISTRIBUTION={posterior auricular and occipitofrontal muscles and skin of external acoustic meatus}; MODALITY={motor and general sensory}
    * *auricular nerve, posterior, auricular branch*; DISTRIBUTION={supplies the auricularis posterior and the intrinsic muscles on the cranial surface of the auricula, in some mammals these muscles can adjust the direction of the pinna (outer ear); CN X sensory from ear skin}; FIBERS={GSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EAR Ear,TARGET.TSA.EAR] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_GNG Geniculate Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.GNG]; SVE:[BrainRegionHMA_HP_FCM Facial Motor Nucleus,HMA.HP.FCM] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EAR Ear,TARGET.TSA.EAR]}
    * *auricular nerve, posterior, occipital branch*; DISTRIBUTION={MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne242.htm OCCIPITAL BRANCH OF POSTERIOR AURICULAR NERVE]; supplies the occipitalis muscles to move the scalp}; FIBERS={GSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_FACE Face,TARGET.TEA.FACE] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_GNG Geniculate Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.GNG]; SVE:[BrainRegionHMA_HP_FCM Facial Motor Nucleus,HMA.HP.FCM] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_FACE Face,TARGET.TEA.FACE]}
    * <img src="http://o.quizlet.com/i/Xc5TCBFZXr6AYTjSt04acA.jpg">
   * *stapedius nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne176.htm NERVE TO STAPEDIUS]); ORIGIN={facial nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={stapedius muscle}; MODALITY={motor}; FIBERS={SVE:[BrainRegionHMA_HP_FCM Facial Motor Nucleus,HMA.HP.FCM] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EAR Ear,TARGET.TSA.EAR]}
   * *intermediate nerve*; ORIGIN={the smaller root of the facial nerve, lying between the main root and the vestibulocochlear nerve; it joins the main root at, or merges with, the geniculate ganglion at the geniculum of the facial nerve}; BRANCHES={chorda tympani and greater petrosal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={lacrimal, nasal, palatine, submandibular, and sublingual glands, and anterior two-thirds of tongue}; MODALITY={parasympathetic and special sensory}
    * *chorda tympani* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne175.htm CHORDA TYMPANI]); ORIGIN={branch of the facial nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={parasympathetic to submandibular ganglion to submandibular, sublingual and buccal glands; supplying the submandibular and sublingual glands and the anterior two thirds of the tongue (taste)}; MODALITY={presynaptic parasympathetic and special sensory}; FIBERS={GVE:[BrainRegionAVA_HM_SAL_SSL Superior Salivatory Nucleus,AVA.HM.SAL.SSL] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_PSYM_SXG Submandibular Ganglion,AVA.PN.PSYM.SXG] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH]; SVA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_GNG Geniculate Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.GNG] -> [BrainRegionHMA_HM_SOL Solitary Nucleus,HMA.HM.SOL]}
     * *communicating branch of chorda tympani with lingual nerve*; ORIGIN={terminal branch of chorda tympani joining the lingual nerve in the infratemporal fossa}; DISTRIBUTION={conveys sensory fibers for taste from anterior two thirds of tongue, presynaptic parasympathetic fibers destined for submandibular ganglion for innervation of submandibular and sublingual salivary glands}
    * *petrosal nerve, greater* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne172.htm GREATER PETROSAL NERVE]); ORIGIN={intermediate nerve via geniculate GANGLION}; DISTRIBUTION={running forward from the geniculate ganglion, it joins the deep petrosal nerve of the pterygoid canal, and reaches lacrimal, nasal, and palatine glands and nasopharynx, via pterygopalatine ganglion and its branches}; MODALITY={parasympathetic and general sensory}; FIBERS={GVE:[BrainRegionAVA_HM_SAL_SSL Superior Salivatory Nucleus,AVA.HM.SAL.SSL] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_PSYM_PTG Pterygopalatine Ganglion,AVA.PN.PSYM.PTG]; SVA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_GNG Geniculate Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.GNG] -> [BrainRegionHMA_HM_SOL Solitary Nucleus,HMA.HM.SOL]} (see [http://www.nature.com/jcbfm/journal/v20/n4/fig_tab/9590926f7.html picture])
     * *nasopalatine nerve, parasympathetic fibers* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne231.htm NASOPALATINE NERVE]); ORIGIN={pterygopalatine GANGLION}; DISTRIBUTION={carries postganglionic parasympathetic GVE fibers to nasal and palatine glands}; MODALITY={parasympathetic}; FIBERS={GVE:[BrainRegionAVA_HM_SAL_SSL Superior Salivatory Nucleus,AVA.HM.SAL.SSL] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_PSYM_PTG Pterygopalatine Ganglion,AVA.PN.PSYM.PTG] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_NOSE Nose,TARGET.TSA.NOSE]}
     * *palatine nerve, parasympathetic fibers* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne151.htm PALATINE BRANCHES OF PTERYGOPALATINE GANGLION]); MODALITY={parasympathetic}; FIBERS={GVE:[BrainRegionAVA_HM_SAL_SSL Superior Salivatory Nucleus,AVA.HM.SAL.SSL] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_PSYM_PTG Pterygopalatine Ganglion,AVA.PN.PSYM.PTG] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH]}
      * *palatine nerve, greater, parasympathetic fibers* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne226.htm GREATER PALATINE NERVE]; palatine nerve, parasympathetic fibers, anterior); ORIGIN={greater petrosal nerve to pterygopalatine GANGLION}; BRANCHES={posterior inferior (lateral) nasal branches}; DISTRIBUTION={greater palatine PSN synapse on the hard palate and regulate mucous glands located there}
      * *palatine nerves, lesser, parasympathetic fibers* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne227.htm LESSER PALATINE NERVES]); ORIGIN={pterygopalatine GANGLION}; DISTRIBUTION={lesser palatine nerve synapses at the soft palate and controls sparse taste receptors and mucous gland, to uvula (middle palatine), to tonsils (posterior palatine), racemose glands, and some muscular fibers (musculus uvulae)}
     * *pharyngeal nerve*; ORIGIN={a nerve running from the posterior part of the pterygopalatine GANGLION, through the pharyngeal canal with the pharyngeal branch of the maxillary artery} DISTRIBUTION={to the mucous membrane of the nasal part of the pharynx posterior to the auditory tube, pharyngeal gland}; MODALITY={parasympathetic}; FIBERS={GVE:[BrainRegionAVA_HM_SAL_SSL Superior Salivatory Nucleus,AVA.HM.SAL.SSL] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_PSYM_PTG Pterygopalatine Ganglion,AVA.PN.PSYM.PTG] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH]}
<img src="https://fbcdn-sphotos-d-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-prn1/150876_602087903154182_135560929_n.jpg">
  * *glossopharyngeal nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne186.htm GLOSSOPHARYNGEAL NERVE]; ninth cranial nerve, IX); ORIGIN={several ROOTLETS from lateral side of upper part of medulla oblongata, between the olive and the inferior cerebellar peduncle}; BRANHES={tympanic nerve, pharyngeal, stylopharyngeal, tonsillar, and lingual branches, branch to the carotid sinus, and a branch communicating with the auricular branch of the vagus nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={it has two enlargements (superior and inferior ganglia) and supplies the tongue, pharynx, and parotid gland}; MODALITY={motor, parasympathetic, and general, special, and visceral sensory}
   * *tympanic nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne190.htm TYMPANIC BRANCH OF GLOSSOPHARYNGEAL NERVE]; Jacobson's nerve); ORIGIN={inferior GANGLION of glossopharyngeal nerve}; BRANCHES={helps form tympanic plexus}; DISTRIBUTION={mucous membrane of tympanic cavity, mastoid air cells, auditory tube, and, via lesser petrosal nerve and otic ganglion, the parotid gland}; MODALITY={general sensory and parasympathetic}; FIBERS={GSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EAR Ear,TARGET.TSA.EAR] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_PET Petrosal Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.PET] -> [BrainRegionHMA_HM_TGM_STR Spinal Trigeminal Nucleus,HMA.HM.TGM.STR]; GVE:[BrainRegionAVA_HM_SAL_ISL Inferior Salivatory Nucleus,AVA.HM.SAL.ISL] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_PSYM_OTG Otic Ganglion,AVA.PN.PSYM.OTG] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH]}
   * *glossopharyngeal nerve, stylopharyngeal branch* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne189.htm PHARYNGEAL BRANCHES OF GLOSSOPHARYNGEAL NERVE]); DISTRIBUTION={muscle of the pharynx, stylopharyngeus}; MODALITY={motor}; FIBERS={SVE:[BrainRegionHMA_HM_AMB Ambiguus Nucleus,HMA.HM.AMB] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH]}
   * *glossopharyngeal nerve, tonsillar branch* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne247.htm TONSILLAR BRANCHES OF GLOSSOPHARYNGEAL NERVE]); DISTRIBUTION={supply the palatine tonsil, forming around it a plexus from which filaments are distributed to the soft palate and fauces, where they communicate with the palatine nerves, taste}; MODALITY={sensory fibers from palatine tonsillar fossa}; FIBERS={GVA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_JUG Jugular Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.JUG] -> [BrainRegionHMA_HM_SOL Solitary Nucleus,HMA.HM.SOL]}
   * *glossopharyngeal nerve, lingual branch* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne240.htm LINGUAL BRANCHES OF GLOSSOPHARYNGEAL NERVE]); DISTRIBUTION={one supplies the vallate papilla and the mucous membrane covering the base of the tongue; the other supplies the mucous membrane and follicular glands of the posterior part of the tongue, and communicates with the lingual nerve, innervate all the muscles of the tongue except for palatoglossus}; MODALITY={sensory}; FIBERS={GSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_JUG Jugular Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.JUG] -> [BrainRegionHMA_HM_TGM_STR Spinal Trigeminal Nucleus,HMA.HM.TGM.STR]}
   * *Hering's nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne237.htm CAROTID SINUS NERVE]; glossopharyngeal nerve, branch to carotid sinus); DISTRIBUTION={innervate the carotid sinus and the carotid body, communicates with the vagus nerve and sympathetic then divides in the angle of bifurcation of the common carotid artery to supply the carotid body (chemoreceptors) and carotid sinus (baroreceptors)}; MODALITY={sensory}; FIBERS={SVA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_HEART Heart,TARGET.TEA.HEART] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_PET Petrosal Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.PET] -> [BrainRegionHMA_HM_SOL Solitary Nucleus,HMA.HM.SOL]}
<img src="http://jacusers.johnabbott.qc.ca/~paul.anderson/806%20LAB%20ANSWERS/BRAINLAB/glossopharyngealIX.JPG">
  * *hypoglossal nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne278.htm HYPOGLOSSAL NERVE]; twelfth cranial nerve, XII); ORIGIN={several ROOTLETS in the anterolateral sulcus between the olive and the pyramid of the medulla oblongata; it passes through the hypoglossal canal to the tongue}; BRANCHES={lingual branches}; DISTRIBUTION={styloglossus, hyoglossus, and genioglossus muscles and intrinsic muscles of the tongue}; MODALITY={motor}; FIBERS={GSE:[BrainRegionHMA_HM_HYG Hypoglossal Motor Nucleus, HMA.HM.HYG] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH]}
   * *communicating branches between the lingual nerve and hypoglossal nerve*; DISTRIBUTION={forming a plexus on the hypoglossus muscle}
<img src="http://what-when-how.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/tmp15F31_thumb.jpg" height=500>
  * *oculomotor nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne126.htm OCULOMOTOR NERVE]; third cranial nerve, III); ORIGIN={BRAIN STEM, emerging medial to cerebral peduncles and running forward in the cavernous sinus}; BRANCHES={superior and inferior branches}; DISTRIBUTION={entering the orbit through the superior orbital fissure, the branches supply the levator muscle of upper eyelid, all extrinsic eye muscles except the lateral rectus and superior oblique, and carry parasympathetic fibers for the ciliary muscle and sphincter pupillae}; MODALITY={motor and parasympathetic}; FIBERS={GSE:[BrainRegionVBA_MM_OCN Oculomotor Nucleus,VBA.MM.OCN] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EYE Eye,TARGET.TSA.EYE]; GVE:[BrainRegionVBA_MM_EWN Edinger-Westphal Nucleus,VBA.MM.EWN] -> [BrainRegionVBA_PN_PSYM_CLG Ciliary Ganglion,VBA.PN.PSYM.CLG] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EYE Eye,TARGET.TSA.EYE]}
   * *oculomotor nerve, inferior branch* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne221.htm INFERIOR RAMUS OF OCULOMOTOR NERVE]); DISTRIBUTION={inferior rectus}
   * *oculomotor nerve, superior branch* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne225.htm SUPERIOR RAMUS OF OCULOMOTOR NERVE]); DISTRIBUTION={supplies superior rectus and levator palpebrae superioris}
    * *ciliary nerves, short, parasympathetic fibers* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne224.htm SHORT CILIARY NERVES]); ORIGIN={ciliary GANGLION}; DISTRIBUTION={smooth muscle and tunics of eye}; MODALITY={parasympathetic}; FIBERS={GVE:[BrainRegionVBA_MM_EWN Edinger-Westphal Nucleus,VBA.MM.EWN] -> [BrainRegionVBA_PN_PSYM_CLG Ciliary Ganglion,VBA.PN.PSYM.CLG] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EYE Eye,TARGET.TSA.EYE]}

  * *olfactory nerves* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/olfactory.htm OLFACTORY NERVE]; first cranial nerve, I); ORIGIN={the nerves of smell, consisting of about 20 bundles which arise in the OLFACTORY EPITHELIUM}; DISTRIBUTION={pass through the cribriform plate of the ethmoid bone to the olfactory bulb}; MODALITY={sensory}; FIBERS={SVA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_NOSE Nose,TARGET.TSA.NOSE] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_OLB Olfactory Bulb,AVA.PN.SG.OLB] -> [BrainRegionPHA_FT_AON Anterior Olfactory Nucleus,PHA.FT.AON]}

  * *optic nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne125.htm OPTIC NERVE]; second cranial nerve, II, nerve of sight); ORIGIN={actually part of the central nervous system throughout its course; it consists chiefly of axons and central processes of cells of the ganglionic layer of the RETINA}; DISTRIBUTION={leave the orbit through the optic canal, and joins with its opposite number to form the optic chiasm (the medial fibers of each nerve crossing over to the opposite side), then continues as the optic tract to end in the lateral geniculate body}; MODALITY={sensory}; FIBERS={SSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EYE Eye,TARGET.TSA.EYE] -> [BrainRegionVBA_FD_RT Retina,VBA.FD.RT] -> [BrainRegionVBA_FD_LGN Lateral Geniculate Nucleus,VBA.FD.LGN], [BrainRegionVBA_MM_SC_SUP Superficial Superior Colliculus,VBA.MM.SC.SUP], [BrainRegionVBA_MM_PT_PON Pretectal Olivary Nucleus,VBA.MM.PT.PON], [BrainRegionHTA_FD_HT_SCN Suprachiasmatic Nucleus,HTA.FD.HT.SCN]}
<img src="http://ars.els-cdn.com/content/image/1-s2.0-S0012160607009098-gr2.jpg">
  * *trigeminal nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne128.htm TRIGEMINAL NERVE]; fifth cranial nerve, V); ORIGIN={emerges from the lateral surface of the pons as a MOTOR and a SENSORY ROOT, together with some intermediate fibers, fine touch to principal, crude touch and pain to spinal}; DISTRIBUTION={The sensory root expands into the trigeminal ganglion, which contains the cells of origin of most of the sensory fibers, and from which the three divisions of the nerve arise}; BRANCHES={See mandibular n., maxillary n., and ophthalmic n}; MODALITY={The trigeminal nerve is sensory in supplying the face, teeth, mouth, and nasal cavity, and motor in supplying the muscles of mastication}; FIBERS={[BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_TRG Trigeminal Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.TRG] -> [BrainRegionHMA_HP_PTP_PTR Principal Trigeminal Nucleus,HMA.HP.PTP.PTR],[BrainRegionHMA_HM_TGM_STR Spinal Trigeminal Nucleus,HMA.HM.TGM.STR]}
   * *mandibular nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne156.htm MANDIBULAR NERVE]; one of three terminal divisions of the trigeminal nerve); ORIGIN={trigeminal GANGLION}; BRANCHES={meningeal branch, masseteric, deep temporal, lateral and medial pterygoid, buccal, auriculotemporal, lingual, and inferior alveolar nerves}; DISTRIBUTION={passing through the foramen ovale to the infratemporal fossa, extensive distribution to muscles of mastication, skin of face, mucous membrane of mouth, and teeth}; MODALITY={general sensory and motor}
    * *auriculotemporal nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne164.htm AURICULOTEMPORAL NERVE]); ORIGIN={by two roots from the mandibular nerve}; BRANCHES={anterior auricular nerve, nerve of external acoustic meatus, parotid branches, branch to tympanic membrane, and branches communicating with facial nerve; its terminal branches are superficial temporal to the scalp}; DISTRIBUTION={parotid gland, scalp in temporal region, tympanic membrane}; MODALITY={parasympathetic, general sensory}
     * *auricular nerves, anterior*; ORIGIN={auriculotemporal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={supply the tragus and upper part of the auricle, skin of anterosuperior part of external ear}; MODALITY={general sensory}; FIBERS={GSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EAR Ear,TARGET.TSA.EAR] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_TRG Trigeminal Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.TRG]}
     * *nerve of external acoustic meatus*; ORIGIN={auriculotemporal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={skin lining external acoustic meatus, and tympanic membrane}; MODALITY={general sensory}; FIBERS={GSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EAR Ear,TARGET.TSA.EAR] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_TRG Trigeminal Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.TRG]}
     * *auriculotemporal nerve, parotid branch*; ORIGIN={auriculotemporal nerve passes medially to the neck of the mandible, gives off parotid branches and then turns superior}; DISTRIBUTION={secretomotor fibers from tympanic plexus to the parotid gland}; MODALITY={parasympathetic}; FIBERS={GVE:[BrainRegionAVA_HM_SAL_ISL Inferior Salivatory Nucleus,AVA.HM.SAL.ISL] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_PSYM_OTG Otic Ganglion,AVA.PN.PSYM.OTG] -> [BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH]}
     * *auriculotemporal nerve, branch to tympanic membrane*; ORIGIN={auriculotemporal nerve comprises exclusively somatosensory fibers, which ascend to the superficial temporal region and there it supplies the supplies the auricle, external acoustic meatus, outer side of the tympanic membrane and the skin in the temporal region}; DISTRIBUTION={outer side of the tympanic membrane and the skin in the temporal region}; MODALITY={sensory}; FIBERS={GSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EAR Ear,TARGET.TSA.EAR] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_TRG Trigeminal Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.TRG]}
     * *auriculotemporal nerve, branches communicating with facial nerve*; ORIGIN={The auriculotemporal nerve then pierces the parotid fascia and enters the retromandibular region of the parotid gland; Within the parotid gland, it breaks up in a spray of branches that immediately and abruptly diverge; Anterior and posterior communicating ramus with the facial nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={They provide sensory fibers for the zygomatic, buccal, and mandibular divisions of the facial nerve to the skin, convey proprioceptive impulses from orbicularis oculi}; MODALITY={sensory}; FIBERS={SSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TSA_EYE Eye,TARGET.TSA.EYE] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_TRG Trigeminal Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.TRG]}
    * *buccal nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne160.htm BUCCAL NERVE]); ORIGIN={mandibular nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={skin and mucous membrane of cheeks, gums, and perhaps the first two molars and the premolars}; MODALITY={general sensory}; FIBERS={GSA:[BrainRegionTARGET_TEA_MOUTH Mouth,TARGET.TEA.MOUTH] -> [BrainRegionAVA_PN_SG_TRG Trigeminal Ganglion,AVA.PN.SG.TRG]}
     * <img src="http://classconnection.s3.amazonaws.com/13/flashcards/2213013/png/innervation_of_the_face1351918585768.png" height=500>
    * *inferior alveolar nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne166.htm INFERIOR ALVEOLAR NERVE]); ORIGIN={mandibular nerve}; BRANCHES={mylohyoid, mental, inferior dental and inferior gingival nerves}; DISTRIBUTION={teeth and gums of lower jaw, skin of chin and lower lip, mylohyoid muscle and anterior belly of digastric muscle}; MODALITY={motor and general sensory}
     * *inferior alveolar nerve, dental branches*; ORIGIN={Within the canal or in their intraosseous course the fascicles of the IAN can either unite into single or double stranded bundles as well as ramify into an ample plexus formation.
